meanings.definition: To sample again, especially in a different way or at a different rate.
meanings.sent1: I will resample the music to see if it sounds better with a new beat.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often resample data to ensure accuracy in their research findings.
meanings.sent3: After burning the cookies, I had to resample the dough and start over.
meanings.sent4: She decided to resample her routine, like a painter trying a new color palette.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to resample the soup multiple times to get the seasoning just right.
